intro: Parosela cliffortiana, commonly known as the cliffortian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
